articles.author: Summer Zhen, Samuel Shen
articles.description: Disillusioned with a weak stock market at home, geopolitical risks and a falling currency, Chinese investors are pouring money into investment products with exposure to overseas assets that will also help diversify their portfolios.
articles.title: Chinese investors rush to offshore funds to offset domestic risks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The post-pandemic trend of people prioritising travel could be a more permanent change in consumers' spending habits, the head of Ireland's largest hotel group Dalata (DHG.I) said on Tuesday.
articles.title: 'Revenge travel' could be here to stay - Irish hotel chief

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo is meeting China's vice premier He Lifeng on Tuesday, her second full day of talks in Beijing, aiming to boost business ties and communications.
articles.title: US commerce chief set to meet Chinese vice premier in Beijing

articles.author: Max Cherney
articles.description: Google unveiled a swath of fresh artificial-intelligence technology and partnerships on Tuesday that were geared toward bringing more of the growing technology to large businesses.
articles.title: Google unveils enterprise AI tools, new AI chip

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Japan may be at an inflection point in its 25-year battle with deflation as price and wage rises show signs of broadening, the government said on Tuesday, signalling its conviction the economy was nearing an end to prolonged stagnation.
articles.title: Japan at 'inflection point' in 25-year battle with deflation - govt

articles.author: Katie Paul, Steve Scherer
articles.description: Meta's (META.O) decision to block news links in Canada this month has had almost no impact on Canadians' usage of Facebook, data from independent tracking firms indicated on Tuesday, as the company faces scorching criticism from the Canadian government over the move.
articles.title: Exclusive: Meta's Canada news ban fails to dent Facebook usage

articles.author: Katie Paul
articles.description: Facebook parent company Meta (META.O) said on Tuesday it had uncovered links between people associated with Chinese law enforcement and the long-running but largely ineffectual pro-China "Spamouflage" influence operation.
articles.title: Meta pins 'Spamouflage' influence campaign on Chinese law enforcement

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has no plans to attend the funeral of Wagner mercenary group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's Putin won't attend Prigozhin funeral - Kremlin

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove
articles.description: The Biden administration on Tuesday released its list of 10 prescription medicines that will be subject to the first-ever price negotiations by the U.S. Medicare health program that covers 66 million people, with big-selling blood thinner Eliquis from Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY.N) and Pfizer (PFE.N) among them.
articles.title: US names first 10 drugs for Medicare price negotiation

articles.author: Danielle Broadway
articles.description: Serena Kashmir has always looked at her acting career as a "spiritual, loving and joyful thing," but after the Hollywood actors' strike began last month, she is taking a big step back from the craft.
articles.title: Hollywood's young actors see career dreams deferred by strikes
